Entropy immediately began to dance, twirling and leaping through the garden."}],["$","p",null,{"children":"As she danced, the crystals began to loosen and move, creating beautiful, random patterns. Colors mixed and swirled in ways they never had before."}],["$","p",null,{"children":"\"What are you doing?\" asked Enthalpy, watching in amazement."}],["$","p",null,{"children":["\"I'm increasing the ",["$","strong",null,{"className":"text-cool","children":"entropy"}],"!\" Entropy laughed. \"The measure of disorder or randomness in a system. The more ways things can be arranged, the higher the entropy!\""]}],["$","p",null,{"children":"Gibbs the Guide appeared beside them. \"The universe always tends toward increasing entropy,\" he explained. \"It's a natural law. Systems with higher entropy are more probable than systems with lower entropy.\""}],["$","p",null,{"children":"\"So our perfect picnic spot...\" Enthalpy began."}],["$","p",null,{"children":"\"...will depend on both energy AND entropy!\" Entropy finished, still dancing."}]]}]}]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"space-y-6","children":[["$","$L8",null,{}],["$","div",null,{"className":"block md:hidden","children":["$","div",null,{"ref":"$undefined","className":"rounded-lg border bg-card text-card-foreground border-none shadow-lg","children":["$","div",null,{"ref":"$undefined","className":"p-4","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"font-fredoka text-lg text-primary mb-2","children":"Entropy"}],["$","div",null,{"className":"rounded-md bg-muted p-3 font-mono text-sm mb-3","children":"ΔS = qrev/T"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-sm text-muted-foreground mb-4","children":"Entropy (S) measures molecular disorder or randomness. The more ways particles can be arranged, the higher the entropy. In our story, Entropy's dance represents increasing disorder and randomness."}]]}],["$","div","1",{"className":"space-y-1","children":[["$","h5",null,{"className":"font-medium text-sm","children":"What does the Second Law of Thermodynamics state?"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-xs text-muted-foreground","children":"The Second Law of Thermodynamics states that the total entropy of an isolated system always increases over time. Systems naturally tend toward states of higher entropy (more disorder)."}]]}],["$","div","2",{"className":"space-y-1","children":[["$","h5",null,{"className":"font-medium text-sm","children":"Why do systems prefer higher entropy?"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-xs text-muted-foreground","children":"Systems with higher entropy are more probable than systems with lower entropy. There are simply more possible ways to arrange particles in a disordered state than in an ordered state."}]]}]]]}]]}]}]}]]}]]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-center justify-between
